Description: faculty research: hypersonic evaluation of inclined plates u. s. department of defense (dod) dayton, oh  organization u. s. department of defense (dod) reference code afit-2020-0032 how to apply components of the online application are as follows: profile information educational and employment history essay questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity) resume (pdf) 1 recommendation(s) submitted documents must have all social security numbers, student identification numbers, and/or dates of birth removed (blanked out, blackened out, made illegible, etc.) prior to uploading into the application system. if you have questions, send an email to airforce@orise. orau. gov. please list the reference code of this opportunity in the subject line of the email. all documents must be in english or include an official english translation. letter of recommendation: while a letter of recommendation is not required to be considered, applicants are required to provide contact information for one recommendation in order to submit the application. applicants are encouraged to request a letter of recommendation before submission as this may help reviewers have a better understanding of the applicant’s qualifications and interests. if selected, a letter recommendation must be submitted on your behalf upon acceptance of the appointment. description afit's mission is to help build america's airpower by educating military and civilian airmen. we innovatively accomplish the air force's core missions in support of joint operations effectively, efficiently, sustainably and affordably. we provide unique defense-focused, research-enabled, multi-disciplinary, advanced academic education, as well as global delivery of career-long, action-based, functional and professional continuing education over a continuum of learning, on-command and on-demand. our success is measured by the career-long contributions of our graduates, faculty and staff. afit accomplishes this mission through four schools: the graduate school of engineering and management, the school of systems and logistics, the civil engineer school, and the school of strategic force studies. to learn more about the research performed at afit, please visit www. afit. edu. this research will focus on forming the wave system around a flat plate, considering subsonic, supersonic and hypersonic velocities and allowing for structural deformation. various angles of attack will be considered. the project will start with an infinite thin plate at a given angle of attachment at a velocity of mach 8, which will allow for a comparison to known results. john anderson has a solution in his book hypersonic and high temperature gas dynamics, second edition, that will allow comparison. the candidate should be well versed in cfd and have the ability to couple the analysis to the structural deformation. the end result is a program which can integrate fs interaction. it is anticipated that the participant will submit an archival paper and a integrated program carrying out the fs interaction produced. this faculty participant will receive valuable experience and knowledge carrying out this research, leading up to hypersonics, that he can bring back to his class. appointment length this appointment is a two month research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant. participant benefits participants will receive a stipend to be determined by afit. stipends are typically based on the participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location. other benefits may include the following: health insurance supplement. participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through orise. relocation allowance training and travel allowance nature of appointment the participant will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with orise, orau, dod, or any other office or agency. instead, the participant will be affiliated with orise for the administration of the appointment through the orise appointment letter and terms of appointment. qualifications background in hypersonic flow simulation and cfd. tenured or tenure-track faculty at an accredited university eligibility requirements citizenship: u. s. citizen only degree: any degree . discipline(s): communications and graphics design computer sciences earth and geosciences engineering environmental and marine sciences life health and medical sciences mathematics and statistics nanotechnology other physical sciences physics social and behavioral sciences

baseband hardware design engineer apple santa clara valley, ca 95014  summary posted: may 10, 2019 role number:200034018 imagine what you could do here. at apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. the people who work here have reinvented entire industries with all apple hardware products. the same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our dedication to leave the world better than we found it. join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking apple product. do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? as a member of our dynamic group, you will have the unique and rewarding opportunity to craft upcoming products that will delight and inspire millions of apple's customers every single day. are you ready to join our rf design- platform architecture team? key qualifications bsee with 5 or more years of industry experience in: mobile and/or embedded processors memory systems, power supply/power management, and high speed digital interfaces experience with power management circuits strong analog and digital ee fundamentals experience with schematic capture/layout/simulation hands-on experience with prototype bring-up, test, and debug familiarity with common test equipment (oscilloscopes, protocol analyzers, logic analyzers, etc.) capable in scripting/programming for test automation and data manipulation/analysis (python, lua, bash) strong problem solving and analytical skills experience interacting with contract manufacturing partners familiarity with the challenges of development for high-volume manufacturing. excellent written and verbal communicator, consistent track recorda of working in a dynamic cross functional team. well organized and have the ability to be flexible in a changing work environment. basic knowledge of wireless standards and rf fundamentals, not required, but nice to have description be a part of a best-in-class design team responsible for the architecture, design, implementation, and integration of the baseband systems for all apple products. you will be familiar with computer system architecture and digital design. you also work with cross-functional engineering groups. day-to-day tasks will include: schematic capture pcb design prototype bring-up and debugging, failure analysis, functional verification, and manufacturing support collaboration with technology suppliers, vendors, cross-functional staff, and contract manufacturers education & experience bsee or equivalent required; msee or equivalent preferred

product design engineer springs window fashions middleton, wi 53562  description: springs window fashions has been part of the window treatments industry since 1939. headquartered in middleton wi, we have over 8,000 associates and 18 locations worldwide. our products are available in nearly every major retailer, in thousands of designer showrooms and showcased in large commercial buildings. our company is privately owned with products marketed across a broad portfolio of brands including bali, graber, sunsetter and mecho. we pride ourselves as “the best experience company”, striving to provide the best experience for our consumers, channel partners, and associates. our department product and textile engineering support both the “grow the business” and “run the business” activities. from simple changes and updates to complex development projects. these team members design, develop, and validate the components and assemblies that are sold through our retail, dealer, and commercial channels.  mission responsible for creating, supporting, and developing new and innovative product/process designs and redesigning existing products/processes. this is successfully accomplished by understanding, accurately specifying, and adhering to customer requirements, utilizing and applying quality tools and methods and pursuing continuous improvement in all aspects of product and process design. these efforts will have a direct impact on reducing labor and material costs, while improving value, reliability, and performance. product responsibilities include graber, bali and nanik branded products and all support componentry. the associate will plan and manage product design engineering activities related to conceptualization, product design, and manufacturing process functions.  objectives concept development (30%) involved in identifying consumer and market needs, translating customer needs into product requirements using process (qfd) and product requirements into design specifications. develops working prototypes of multiple concepts, which can be used for functional evaluation. involved with consumer focus groups to gather market data. involved in reducing concept to commercially viable product. creates mechanical drawings and 3-d models using drafting software. investigates concept patentability and infringement issues related to concepts to assess legal liability protect intellectual property. design development (50%) coordinates and prioritizes design and product engineering activities as established by npd and product management and in accordance with spring's business strategies and goals. designs products and components with safety, durability, reliability, value, and assembly as priorities. develops and plans short- and long-term goals in accordance with spring's strategies and goals. establish design specifications, material selection, and potential suppliers with regards to product design. estimates project and product costs, assists with project justification, and recommends required materials and tooling. facilitates design reviews to discuss concepts and proposed product designs, engaging other functional areas of the business, to gain input regarding product manufacturability and incorporating those inputs into final design. prepares and issues required reports, summaries, and presentations related to engineering activities. maintains and controls engineering files, records, and documentation for part and process specifications, drawings, and patents. interface with purchasing and suppliers to resolve supplier quality issues. administrative (20%) collaborate with new product development and marketing teams to introduce and develop new product concepts and existing product enhancements. support efforts to maintain and follow the new product development (stage gate) process. reviews related patents and assesses potential patent risks engaged in continuous improvement initiatives, recognizing process improvement methods to identify root cause, develop solutions, and implement solutions. maintain and organize lab area following 5s principles. represent the company in industrial organizations. requirements: education and experience bs in engineering with a minimum of 4 years of applicable work experience. must be flexible with job assignments, able to work independently and well with others (team environment). must be organized, methodical, and handle multiple tasks simultaneously and work to an established timeline. position takes direction from engineering manager or new product development manager. must manage multiple medium or limited scope projects, must communicate well and properly document results of test procedures. knowledge, skills and abilities conceptual and detail design skills must be very creative and excel at innovation process familiar with translation tools and processes (quality function deployment qfd) experience with 3 dimensional drawing (solid works, autocad) experience and knowledge of typical drafting standards experience with metal and wood machine tools data collection and management of database. technical writing skills for memos, lab reports, and project updates. strong general math skills (add, subtract, multiply, divide, percentages, fractions, metric conversions, algebra, and geometry) good interpersonal skills good analytical and problem solving skills good communication skills (verbal, written) general computer skills excel, ms word, lotus notes, ms project and access manage work according to established project timelines. preference given to candidates with bs degree in mechanical engineering or industrial design 5+ years design engineering experience in consumer products related industry relevant experience with new product development and product design role familiarity with the design of injection molded plastic parts, die cast and die stamped metal parts, aluminum extrusions, and molded wood products.  behavioral competencies ensures accountability holding self and others accountable to meet commitments drive engagement creating a climate where people are motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives instill trust gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity drive results consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances consumer/customer focus building strong customer relationships and delivering on customer-centric solutions critical thinking making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems being resilient rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations optimize work processes knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement

transmission line engineer hdr minneapolis, mn  transmission line engineer - (156531) description  about us at hdr, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. while we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. we create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. that's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. hdr is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.   watch our 'about us' video  we believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. that ideas inspire positive change. that coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. and that small details yield important realizations. above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.  hdr engineering is looking for a transmission project engineer to join our growing and nationally ranked team of power delivery professionals in our minneapolis, mn office. the primary duties of the project engineer include responsibility for knowledge and execution of the technical aspects and deliverables of projects assigned and is an experienced, competent engineer who generally understands and can complete all technical requirements of transmission line projects of basic to moderate complexity. assigns tasks and provides guidance to junior team members and coordinates qc reviews for work performed by junior level engineers and/or designers. the project engineer will also be responsible for quality control reviews of projects from other teams on an as needed basis. the project engineer works independently and may direct, mentor, train, and/or supervise efforts of less-experienced eit's and/or designers.  primary responsibilities conducting analyses to develop design options. performing pls-cadd modeling and/or calculations. assisting with preparing cost estimates or specifications. perform routine engineering and design tasks. participate in field reviews or construction observation. perform other duties as assigned. li-bc1  qualifications  required qualifications  bachelor's degree in engineering required (civil, electrical, or mechanical engineering preferred). professional engineer (p. e.) license 4+ years of experience designing power delivery projects. experience using pls-cadd, structure analysis, project cost estimates, plan and profile preparation, optimization, specifications and drawings, and other engineering documents required for power transmission line projects. proficient with microsoft office. strong written and verbal communication skills. an attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must. some field work and travel may be required. preferred qualification national electrical safety code (nesc) knowledge is desired. previous experience with an architectural/engineering or engineering consulting firm desired. preference will be given to local candidates.  why hdr  at hdr, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. when you join hdr, we give you license to do the same. we help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.  primary location: united states-minnesota-minneapolis industry: power schedule: full-time employee status: regular businessclass: transmission/distribution eng job posting: dec 3, 2019

project engineer kettler leweck engineering san diego, ca 92101  a qualified candidate must have 5 – 7 years of experience in a variety of project types and posses a bsce. a professional civil engineering license in the state of california is highly desired. experience must include independent preparation and processing of public grading and improvement plans, storm drain systems design, water and sewer systems design, detention basin design, hydro-modification (hmp) design, water quality/bmp design, technical studies/reports, and site plan design. acad civil 3d experience is required and npdes experience is desirable. candidate must demonstrate good oral and written communication skills and have knowledge of san diego area jurisdictional codes, standards, and procedures. apply now to info@kettlerleweck. com

camera driver engineer apple santa clara valley, ca 95014  summary posted: feb 20, 2019 role number:200038398 apple's camera drivers team is looking for an exceptional engineer to drive state of the art technologies for apple products. as part of the team you will work on core camera and machine learning technologies, including ios/macos kernel drivers, and low-level camera control frameworks. you will have the chance to define the way that apple develops, tests, and manufactures all of its products. our close-knit team fosters an environment of product innovation, rapid product iteration, and collaboration at both the team, and multi-functional levels, with a liberating amount of autonomy. key qualifications excellent programming skills and knowledge of c/c++ 4+ years related driver development experience on mac os x, windows, or linux excellent debugging, and problem solving skills knowledge of modern digital camera technologies, image sensors, and isp pipelines knowledge of image formats, video codecs, and color spaces. experience in hardware/software co-simulation, and pre-silicon validation experience with software performance analysis, optimizations and low-level programming strong communication and teamwork skills description in this role you will: 1. maintain existing ios/macos drivers, and develop new drivers for future products, and camera technologies. 2. be involved in isp feature specifications, pre-silicon validation, silicon bring-up, api development, and tools creation. you will work with other teams to define features and communication protocols, and document the requirements clearly with implementation specifications. 3. support products from the early development and prototyping phases, through to mass production. 4. work on hw validation, and provide software support to factory testing. you will also implement features to support hardware testing and diagnosis. this is a highly multi-functional product development role, and you will work closely with various teams, like silicon design, camera hardware, qa, and the media frameworks team. the environment is dynamic, fast-paced and requires a self-starter attitude. education & experience bs or ms in computer science or electrical engineering

simulation specialist hennepin healthcare minneapolis, mn  hennepin healthcare has a current opening for a simulation specialist in our interdisciplinary simulation department this full-time position will work weekdays and occasional evenings. the simulation specialist will operate and maintain the isec equipment under the direction of the simulation center manager. this position will also assist in the design, implementation and evaluation of simulation activities and course outcomes.  responsibilities maintain timely set-up, supply stocking and turnover for daily simulation and educational activities maintain and update simulation center equipment and supplies needed to perform educational activities oversee and assist with operation and usage of computers, high and low fidelity manikins, procedural skills trainers, virtual reality trainers, av equipment, & related operating software maintain technical expertise for operation and trouble-shooting of all simulation center equipment assist with design, implementation and evaluation of simulation courses to ensure quality education experiences teach adjunct faculty and learners how to use and care for simulation equipment appropriately during educational sessions identify & implement opportunities for improvement and innovation in the simulation center act in accordance with the isec policies and procedures, and enforces them when necessary perform operational management as needed, including scheduling, documentation, communications, record keeping, and data management & reporting assist with accreditation processes and research studies maintain data security and confidentiality in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local guidelines maintain professional growth and development through seminars, workshops, current literature, and professional affiliations to keep abreast of latest trends in simulation and gaming perform other duties as assigned   qualifications minimum qualifications: background in computer use, set up, trouble shooting and maintenance of technology equipment and/ or manikins experience with simulation technology experience with multimedia equipment and digital audiovisual technology and production -or-  an approved equivalent combination of education and experience preferred qualifications: health professions degree or experience experience with healthcare simulation technology previous teaching experience in health professions 2 or more years in technology related field organization and project management experience video processing & editing experience knowledge/ skills/ abilities: ability to improvise, adapt to highly dynamic environments, and learn new skills demonstrates proficiency with windows  you've made the right choice in considering hennepin healthcare for your employment. we offer a wealth of opportunities for individuals who want to make an impact in our patients' lives. we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to both current and prospective employees. we are driven to connect talented individuals with life-changing career opportunities, enabling you to provide exceptional care without exception. thank you for considering hennepin healthcare as a future employer. please note: offers of employment from hennepin healthcare are conditional and contingent upon successful water quality control division director nacwa denver, co  salary: depends on qualifications  what you'll be doing: colorado seeks a grounded visionary and empathetic leader to set a division-wide vision and support a team working to advance water quality, environmental protection and health. the division staff include scientists, engineers, technicians, administrators, and environmental specialists. environmental program staff, in close partnership with stakeholders, the regulated community, local governments and the attorney general’s office, use a combination of engineering, epidemiology, community infrastructure support, public outreach, technical and compliance assistance, permitting, monitoring, inspections, and enforcement to achieve the desired public health and environment outcomes.  this position manages division programs who are responsible for: administering authority delegated by the epa; implementing federal and state statutes including the clean water act and safe drinking water act; supporting colorado communities through community engagement and outreach as well as infrastructure support; ensuring decisions are evidence-based and data-informed which requires reliance on complex scientific, engineering, performance data and methodologies; developing new programming to address emerging contaminants, environmental justice, health equity and real-time water quality needs across colorado.  the position is a member of the environmental programs leadership team. the position reports to the environmental programs director on policy matters and the environmental programs operations manager on operational matters.  essential responsibilities  the responsibilities are listed below move from concept to detailed action. the responsibilities are co-occurring and are not listed by priority or time spent. the position must bring multiple perspectives to each opportunity to serve, and process multiple levels of information at one time and relate them to each other. to do this effectively requires a suite of executive management skills to balance opportunity with sustained implementation.  vision and leadership: determine strategic goals, objectives and initiatives for the water quality control division, including long-range plans and initiatives that require extensive stakeholder outreach with the regulated community, environmental advocates, state and local elected officials. establish priorities for the improvement and protection of water quality in the state, and for protection of the state's drinking water systems and infrastructure.  determine whether and how to focus division resources and develop or modify state water quality standards and other requirements through water quality control commission rulemaking. development of standards requires the employment of the best science on how pollutants will impact water quality, health and the environment while considering economic implications, technological feasibility and other competing interests. where appropriate, this position will identify and secure funding to support communities and regulated entities in enhancing water quality.  external outreach and communication: liaise and support other division leadership in liaising with federal, state, local and community based partners, stakeholders including advocates, communities. balance partnership and community level lens with tailored listening, problem solving and customer service for individuals and a single entity needing the division’s help.  ensure program communications align with division, department, and executive branch expectations which include being accurate, focused on environmental and public health outcomes, empathetic, and person-centered.  ensure department leadership is apprised of critical upcoming issues and developments.  management/direction: manage a division of approximately 205 employees, most of them involved in highly technical and complicated projects. conduct personnel planning, budgeting, and other management tasks for the division.  enable and support creative thinking within the operating parameters directed in statute, federal agreements, regulations, state agreements, mous, department policies, universal policies, office of human resources directions, department operating principles and environmental programs procedures and similar directives, as well as established and evolving concepts of the services provided by the division; interpret circumstances in a variety of situations and establish guidelines that direct how a program will be implemented; evaluate and communicate risk for the department, partner agencies, operator and community when developing service solutions.  direct the development and implement of regulation, community engagement, relationship management, written and oral communication, legislation, strategic planning and strategic priority activities, and division health equity and environmental justice efforts. engage staff in strategic planning and the development of measures, work plans, communication plans or implementation plans; implement business solutions that are targeted, measurable, data-driven, and fit within existing legal, budget, and policy constraints. develop, populate and manage workload to dashboards. enhance each program by reducing cost, increasing quality, improving timeliness, increasing effectiveness through process improvement or changing service delivery to leverage modern approaches. create, modify and abolish programs, positions and procedures as needed to meet the current and long-term needs of the organization; prune, prioritize and right size activities; discontinue efforts that are not achieving outcomes. recommend organizational changes in the division structure to maximize strengths, increase efficiency or align resources to division priorities.  assess complex operational issues and environmental legal and policy options in the face of competing interests and opinions, involving the state legislature and governor’s office, business and environmental organizations, water quality control commission, colorado congressional delegation and other members of congress, the epa and other federal agencies such as the u. s. department of agriculture. determine the approach course after considering feedback, direct a course and monitor new information to determine if it is appropriate to stay or change course.  identify and prioritize significant existing, emerging or cross-cutting issues and either determine the course of action in response to these issues or recommend a course of action to department leadership.  supervision, compliance and program management: supervise direct reports who oversee the day-to-day implementation of various work activities within the programs. accountable for attaining program objectives in a manner that complies with all laws and directives under which the program operates; manage personnel time management, behavior and performance management; set expectations with clearly defined roles and responsibilities through the division and organization, any activities staffed through matrix management and ad-hoc, short-term projects; monitor the results of our processes as well as the results of our teams; provide timely staff and teams feedback; continuously evaluate, problem-solve and communicate the direction based upon collecting feedback from the division staff and stakeholders, and an analysis of resources, benefits and risk. serve as the appointing authority for the division and performs all delegated functions including hiring, workforce development and performance management.  establish a workplace, including a remote workplace, culture that embraces forward thinking, innovation, adaptability, efficiency, transparency, accountability, and best practices. seek and retain a dedicated, stable, and well-trained workforce, many of whom are recognized experts in their respective fields and individuals with whom others wish to work; require and hire for a work environment that values subject matter experts and the subject matter expert’s ability to partner with others including but not limited to: hiring for emotional intelligence and strong communication skills, adaptability, diversity and inclusion, a growth mindset that can handle the complexity, variability and evolving nature of the work, commitment to the department and division mission and vision. work with staff to solve problems and to develop new skills. determine the best methods to maximize employee performance. utilize the department of personnel and administration, department, environmental programs and division mechanisms, training, and opportunities to build individual capacity, trust and inclusive culture within the division; share leadership by identifying bands of activity, where staff have the opportunity to serve as a liaison, subject matter expert or work lead to build the capacity within the branch; set a culture that values coaching, mentoring, on the job training and continuous education; support staff and work units through employee or team recognition, engagement, encouragement and honest feedback. consider impacts to the budget when assessing solutions to improve performance.  minimum qualifications, substitutions, conditions of  employment & appeal rights: minimum qualifications: six (6) years leadership experience at an upper management/executive level, including experience managing second and third level supervisors, organizational management, team development and strategic planning and execution  demonstrated commitment to environmental health and protection, environment, pollution planning, prevention, mitigation or management.  graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree in engineering, business, environment sciences, public administration, urban planning (city planning) or closely related degree  section 25-8-301(3), c. r. s., requires the position be employed pursuant to section 13 of article xii of the state constitution. statute also requires the person serving in the position be a licensed professional engineer or have a graduate degree in engineering or other specialty dealing with the problems of pollution and shall also have appropriate practical and administrative experience related to such problems.  this experience must be substantiated within the work experience section of your application. "see resume" will not be accepted. in addition, part-time work will be prorated.  substitutions: additional appropriate experience will substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis.  additional appropriate education will substitute for the required general experience on a year-for-year basis.  conditions of employment: must be willing and able to travel independently throughout the state up to 15% of the time including overnight stays.  a pre-employment criminal background check will be conducted as part of the selection process. all job finalists require successful completion of a background investigation and reference check prior to appointment. felony convictions or conviction of crimes of moral turpitude or convictions of misdemeanors related to job duties may disqualify you from being considered for this position. should your background check reveal any charges and convictions, it is your responsibility to provide the colorado department of public health and environment human resources office with an official disposition of any charges.  on call status: as condition of employment, candidates must be willing to be on-call in the event the activation of the continuity of operations plan (coop) and be required to report to work immediately at the regular or alternate location. during this time, travel restrictions may be in place.  on-call status: as condition of employment, candidates must be willing to be on-call in the event of an emergency, (e. g., bio-terrorist attack, chemical attack, disease outbreak or all hazards) and be required to report to work immediately at the regular or alternate location. during this time, travel restrictions may be in place.  you must be legally eligible to work in the united states to be appointed to this position. cdphe does not sponsor non-residents of the united states.  preferred qualifications and essential competencies: the preferred experience, competencies and abilities are highly desirable for this position and will be considered in selecting the successful candidate:  people management experience with a demonstrated emotional intelligence, empathy and good listening  commitment to recruiting, supporting, developing and retaining a quality workforce  non-confrontational and consensus-building leadership style that draws upon a servant leadership mindset; a true public servant  demonstrated commitment to equitably and empathetically responding to colorado communities with scientific, evidence-based and data-informed actions  demonstrated successful management experience in an organization of similar size, scope, mission and complexity to the water quality control division, including managing a multiple level organization with a diverse array of competencies and job duties  successful experience forming collaborative and productive partnerships with a diverse set of stakeholders and staff  experience in the organizational and staff development; implementation and evaluation of strategic organizational goals, plans and policies through goal setting, work plans and measurement of outputs and outcomes; and, strategic budgeting  familiarity with the principles of environmental justice  familiarity with and ability to establish metrics defined by risk parameters and health-based outcomes  familiarity with the legislative process and the general process of state agency budget-setting by the legislature  familiarity with clean water or drinking water laws, regulatory frameworks, enforcement and litigation  ability to recognize and discreetly manage sensitive political issues and provide facts and viewpoints to legislative or governor’s staff  politically astute; understands and appreciates differing viewpoints and the geographic/economic diversity in the state of colorado; sensitive to public opinion and the necessity for clarity and transparency in all external stakeholder dealings  strong written and oral communication skills; presence to make effective and persuasive speeches and presentations on complex and emotionally charged issues to diverse groups of stakeholders; a natural “connector” who enjoys meeting with the building rapport with stakeholders  a transformational leader and change agent; possesses the courage to innovate and propose/shepherd major systemic change to make the best use of resources and talent  possesses a personal commitment to environmental issues coupled with the ability to strike an effective balance with the needs of commerce and industry

security, access & cctv design engineer nac mechanical & electrical services saint paul, mn 55110  description: the technologies design engineer position is a representation of nac to our clients and is the liaison between the sales team, operations and the client. the engineer should strive to maintain a team environment by working closely with the sales team, project management and technicians. the engineer must have a well-defined understanding of products such as access control, cctv and cabling infrastructure. the positon will be customer facing and the engineer must enjoy working with others. the engineer will work with vendors to design systems and provide technical and troubleshooting support. the engineer is expected to respond to the client s needs in a timely and cost effective method. the engineer will be committed to maintaining an expert level of knowledge regarding existing and emerging securities technologies.  reports to: vp of sales  responsibilities: include, but are not limited to: maintaining operational readiness of physical security systems through programming, i. t. networking, remote troubleshooting (on site as needed), designing, engineering and administration of access control, video surveillance and other related systems and software.  primary duties of technologies design engineer:  working with potential partners, customers and the sales team in the design and development of security solutions. conducting site surveys with sales team to gather the information necessary to create accurate proposals. collaborating with the sales team to create timely and accurate proposals. supporting the sales process with pre-sale design, drawings and documentation. produce comprehensive system design and documentation (bill of materials, scope of work, budgets/estimation, etc.) work with the sales team to create system drawings and documentation. assist the customer with technical support before, during and after the project. serve as the primary contact for physical security and technology system support  qualifications / skills of the technologies design engineer: technical or bs degree in related field preferred 3-5 years of experience in the security field preferred knowledge of installation of products such as access control, cameras, cabling infrastructure, av/ network racks, wall plates and interfaces ability to read construction documents to inform security design decisions related to building construction and infrastructure. experience with bluebeam preferred. ability to work directly with others or as a group in a team atmosphere. proven oral and written communication skills. excellent customer service skills. the ability to be organized and effective in a fast-paced environment. strong computer skills. detail-oriented and will follow tasks through to completion.  nac is an equal opportunity employer and offers a competitive salary and benefit package for this important position. nac s benefit package includes:  competitive salary and pto policy, group health and dental insurance, hsa and flexible spending plans, 401(k) with employer match and generous company profit sharing.  about the company:  nac is an industry leading mechanical, electrical, and technology contractor located in the twin cities. we provide innovative construction and service solutions for medium and large-scale commercial projects. nac is built on integrity and with its customer-first model, delivers commitment and a strong partnership for each customer. nac offers mechanical and electrical construction; engineering, design and estimation; building automation, controls and system integration; building technologies and systems; fabrication; preventative maintenance and 24/7 service. with our many capabilities and more than 30 years of experience and proven success, nac is the single-source mechanical contractor our customers trust and rely on. our growth and expanding disciplines makes nac a very exciting place to work, offering endless career opportunities for the motivated people on our team.

project manager mei technologies, inc. dayton, oh 45433  overview: mei technologies is growing! meit since 1992 is a nationwide technology company that has implemented process-oriented management and has redefined itself into the family-owned organization that offers innovative, best-value services and solutions within four focused capabilities: engineering services & solutions, modeling and simulation, space systems, design & integration; and it/cyber services & solutions.  why choose meit??  at meit you will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest, most experienced engineering and technology experts in the u. s.!! meit has established proven, quality work methods, including iso, cmmi and as9100 certifications. meit stands by delivering what we promise with flexibility, quality and integrity to our employees and our customers. meit reputation for entering a new market, getting to work and generating immediate and impactful results.  with an abundance of collaborative individuals meit is an organization that provides the opportunity to truly reach your potential as a professional. responsibilities: project manager role the project manager is the primary point of contact (poc) responsible for coordination among the offeror’s team and members of the afsim pmt. responsibilities should include: communicating with the program manager, business manager, and contracting officer to enable timely resolution of programmatic issues and blockers identifying and fulfilling project staffing requirements coordinating agile “ceremonies” such as release and iteration/cycle/sprint planning meetings facilitating project reporting and metrics in line with agile planning, estimation, and control coordinating with the product owner to develop and groom the product backlog qualifications:  join our team today!  www. meitechinc. com meit is an equal opportunity employer /m/f/disability/protected veteran employer. meit is a woman-owned small business (wosb) serving government and commercial sectors across the united states.

principal structural engineer michael page cambridge, ma  mpi does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. mpi encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants. description work directly with architects, owners and contractors. write engineering proposals and negotiate engineering contracts. perform structural analysis and design for all aspects of building structures. lead a team of structural engineers, technicians and designers for all phases of commercial building design projects including: drawing and specification production, construction administration, site observations and building assessments. train junior level engineers and perform independent reviews of drawings and calculations done by others. the successful candidate will utilize their extensive experience to hit the ground running and help develop, manage and deliver multiple projects simultaneously. using your proficient knowledge of civil/structural programs, excellent articulation skills, a positive work ethic and entrepreneurial attitude you will help develop and grow the existing team for future works. experienced in the design of steel, wood, masonry and concrete structures. proficiency with structural analysis software such as ram, risa, staad iii and similar programs. working experience with autocad and revit. ability to effectively establish and maintain relationships with clients. excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. experience with adaptive reuse and historic preservation of existing buildings is a plus. our client is a local privately owned structural engineering consultancy firm known for its ability to identify problems from a different perspective in the structural engineering fields. as it continues to grow they are excited to offer the immediate opportunity for a structural engineering leadership position in its boston office. they are a full-service firm providing design, analysis and evaluation of buildings throughout the northeast. we are seeking a motivated, growth oriented professional with a strong attention to detail to lead the commercial building design practice area. this position is for a fully qualified professional and will afford the successful candidate a unique opportunity to become a key part of the firm's management team. project types and markets include public buildings, municipal buildings, schools, higher education, hospitals, multi-unit housing, retail and office buildings. besides working in a company with a highly regarded reputation - you will be given the opportunity to develop your career to become a vested partner of the firm. you will also receive: excellent salary and the opportunity to work on unique projects focus on work life balance from a privately owned company collaborative team - first environment

project engineer geodesign inc. denver, co  job description geodesign is seeking an experienced project engineer to support and expand our geotechnical services in the denver metro area.  about us  our firm is an nv5 company and provides a full range of geotechnical engineering, environmental, geological, pavement, and mining consulting services. companywide, geodesign’s team includes more than 75 dedicated engineers, geologists, environmental scientists, technical staff, and support personnel, but we are part of a more than 2,500 person firm offering vast opportunities nationwide.  job responsibilities  in your role as a geotechnical project engineer, you’ll be managing the complete lifecycle of each project—from overseeing the geotechnical investigation and design phase to managing our staff providing construction observation services in the field. as a part of the job, you’ll be preparing mid-level analysis and judgments for technical reports and other deliverables, while working alongside our principal engineers. this position may require occasional field work on project sites.  geodesign, an nv5 company, is looking for an exceptional individual with the ability to support our geotechnical team in the denver metro area, develop and maintain local client relationships, and provide an exceptional level of customized engineering consultation.  ties to the local a/e/c industry preferred, as well as a passion for business development and teamwork. this is a wonderful opportunity for an engineer looking to further their career in geotechnical consulting engineering with a team of experts in the field.  requirements exceptional technical capabilities combined with a passion for business development minimum four years of engineering project-level experience master’s degree in geotechnical engineering, required pe required compensation & benefits this position offers a competitive salary and excellent benefits package including, but not limited to: medical/dental/vision/rx, pto, 401(k) savings plan, short-/long-term disability, life insurance, and flexible spending accounts.

principal systems engineer - hls systems architecture sierra nevada corporation louisville, co 80027  snc is seeking talented teammates to join the advanced development (ad) team in developing innovative solutions and to produce state of the art space systems for lunar and deep space exploration. as part of the ad team, individuals will help advance an existing portfolio of programs that provide sustainment for human spaceflight with space habitats and lunar landing systems and delivering commercial payloads to the lunar surface. snc provides high performing innovative systems that change how we reach, explore and utilize space.  the principal systems engineer reports to the program manager on the program he/she is supporting and works in concert with the cognizant technical lead engineers in execution of the program. the principal systems engineer is the system architect that is responsible for the overall design, development, and production of the specific spacecraft, launch and flight operations. the principal systems engineer will oversee all systems engineering and integration efforts to include development of the system architecture, concept of operation, decomposition of requirements, generation and allocation of specifications, control documents, plans and reports in support of the development. the principal systems engineer supports programs from the early phases of program capture through the entire lifecycle of the program. the principal systems engineer should have intimate knowledge of the product technology and a good working knowledge of the associated engineering disciplines.  primary responsibilities include:the system engineer will be: problem solver create solutions to complex problems, and integrate disparate systems and concepts research and analyze alternative technologies; lead trade studies author technical and engineering memos to document decisions and solutions as required technical lead lead the program efforts to interpret customer requirements and decompose them into hardware, software and system requirements and specifications originate specifications, control documents, verification and validation plans, procedures, reports, or other documentation in support of design and development activities define interfaces and develop interface control documents (icd) create architecture diagrams tester develop test plans, test cases, and test procedures including execution scripts coordinate and execute various test events such as development, risk reduction, requirement verification and other system functional/performance testing utilizing software-in-the-loop and hardware-in-the-loop test platform configurations, as well as flight hardware/software configurations communicator lead technical exchange meetings (tems) and other formal and informal engineering discussions with teammates, customers, and external stakeholders brief customers and internal leadership on technical progress, risks, and alternative courses of action prepare material for, and conduct periodic design reviews or major technical reviews, including design and test/launch readiness reviews  team leader: oversee and manage development of subset of team. supporting the creation of, and adherence to, process controls, configuration management requirements, and peer review processes to ensure accuracy and completeness of technical products represent system engineering team at programmatic reviews. provide inputs to team status, including schedule, budget and earned value. metrics definition, tracking and status reporting for the position’s areas of responsibility  refining and updating appropriate sections of the program’s integrated master schedule conducting and providing inputs to personnel performance evaluations  additional responsibilities include: execute engineering design and development activities consistent with customer quality, cost and schedule requirements ensure that all specifications, designs and developments adhere to snc standards and customer requirements provide support in the development and maintaining of configuration baselines for systems and sub-systems support the engineering team on defining system architecture and requirements during proposal efforts follow snc policies, procedures and work instructions for all technical activities punctuality to work each day and prepared to work scheduled work hours other duties as assigned  delegation of authority responsibilities: responsible for thoughtful adherence to all snc delegation of authority requirements review delegation of authority thresholds as applicable to job position stated in the doa responsibilities matrix  compliance responsibilities: responsible for thoughtful adherence to all snc policies, procedures, and compliance regulations (internal and external) responsible for timely execution of all personnel-related activities such as time sheet completion, performance evaluations, salary reviews, succession planning, etc.  education, experience and skills required: requires a bs in related field 15+ years of related experience excellent communication skills required in both verbal and written ability to rapidly work with minimal supervision on projects involving both small and large engineering teams previous experience and skills in project definition, simulation, implementation, lab integration and test must be able to work in a highly collaborative, fast paced environment with emphasizes in rapid prototyping and fielding of capabilities strong propensity for system-level thinking. an ability to understand wide-reaching impacts of decisions across the system. ability to decompose large complicated problems into manageable pieces, understand problems from different points of view, and explain issues/solutions to other engineers and management.  preferred skills: domain expertise in any one, or more, of the following areas: spacecraft structures, thermal control systems (tcs), electrical power systems (eps), propulsion (chemical, solar electric), guidance, navigation and control (gn&c), avionics, communication, flight software, mechanisms, spacecraft integration and test (i&t) tools expertise: doors, rhapsody, dxl, jira, excel vba experience in spacecraft testing experience working on complex systems experience working nasa programs  important notice: itar/ear: to conform to u. s. government export regulations, applicant must be a u. s. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the u. s., protected individual as defined by 8 u. s. c. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the u. s. department of state. sierra nevada corporation is an equal opportunity employer – minority / female / disability / veteran, or any other protected status pursuant to applicable local, state or federal law, ordinance or regulation.

mission is to help build america's airpower by educating military and civilian airmen. we innovatively accomplish the air force's core missions in support of joint operations effectively, efficiently, studies. to learn more about the research performed at afit, please visit www. afit. edu. this research will focus on forming the wave system around a flat plate, considering subsonic, supersonic and comparison. the candidate should be well versed in cfd and have the ability to couple the analysis to the structural deformation. the end result is a program which can integrate fs interaction. it is anticipated that the participant will submit an archival paper and a integrated program carrying out the fs interaction produced. this faculty participant will receive valuable experience and liaison engineer 2-englewood, co (united rotorcraft) air methods englewood, co 80112  job summary   coordinates activities to evaluate and resolve engineering-related production problems encountered in the manufacturing facility. confers with quality control, materials, manufacturing and other department personnel to provide technical support. investigates reports of defective, damaged, or malfunctioning parts, assemblies, equipment, or systems to determine nature and scope of problem, and define solutions. examines, measures, inspects, investigates and tests suspected defective parts for conformance to engineering specifications. evaluates findings to formulate corrective action plans and coordinate implementation. serves as member of material review board (mrb) to determine disposition of defective or damaged parts. checks drawings and suggests changes to improve produce ability and functionality. coordinates repairs iaw oem srms (structural repair manuals) and creates clean-sheet structural repairs (including structural calculations when needed) suitable for submission to the faa via a designated engineering representative (der).  essential functions and responsibilities include the following.   provide short-flow technical, analytical, and data solutions as a means to maintain production and quality assurance (qa) efforts and workflow. coordinate and release engineering change orders (eco) to support production and qa effortscoordinate and expedite material review board (mrb) dispositions to support production and qa effortsprovide technical guidance to facilitate workflow through production and qa areas. work with certification engineers and organization designation authorization (oda) as needed for project deliverablessupport engineering department with development, data release, and analysisother duties as assigned. additional job requirements develops some expertise on federal aviation regulations (fars) and regulatory processes in support of manufacturingsupports customer support personnel and proposes solutions to customer issuesregular scheduled attendanceindicate the percentage of time spent traveling subject to applicable laws and air method’s policies, regular attendance is an essential function of the position. all employees must follow air methods’ employment practices and policies.  supervisory responsibilities  this position has no supervisory responsibilities.   qualifications  to perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. the requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. in accordance with applicable laws, air methods will provide reasonable accommodations that do not create an undue burden so disabled employees may perform the essential functions of the position.  education & experience  bachelor’s degree (bs/ba) in engineering from four-year college or university; and three to five years’ mechanical or aeronautical engineering related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.3-5 years’ experience in a production setting. previous aircraft electrical/engineering knowledge preferred  skills  strong interpersonal skills and a high degree of collaboration at all levelsexcellent organizational skills, detail oriented, ability to prioritize and multi-task and meet deadlinesdependable and self-motivated  computer skills  proficient with microsoft suite, including word, excel, powerpoint and outlook proficient with cad software (autocad and solidworks preferred)  certificates, licenses, registrations none air methods is an eeo/aa employer. qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

nuclear engineer (full time) u. s. navy united states  about nuclear technicians, power plant operators and subsystems specialists are responsible for keeping vital naval submarines and aircraft carriers running. these highly trained, hands-on professionals perform the complex technical functions that are at the core of sub and carrier capabilities.  their job involves everything from operating nuclear propulsion plant machinery, to controlling auxiliary equipment that supports naval reactors, to maintaining various electronic, propulsion and weapons systems.  more information  responsibilities responsibilities in the navy nuclear operations area depend on your job rating or specialty.  machinist mate (mm)  mms operate and maintain steam turbines and reduction gears used for ship propulsion and auxiliary machinery such as turbogenerators, pumps and oil purifiers. they also maintain auxiliary machinery outside of main machinery spaces, such as electrohydraulic steering engines and elevators, refrigeration plants, air conditioning systems and desalinization plants. they may also operate and maintain compressed gas producing plants. nuclear-trained mms perform duties in nuclear propulsion plants operating reactor control, propulsion and power generation systems.  electrician’s mate (em)  ems are responsible for the operation of a ship's electrical power generation systems, lighting systems, electrical equipment and electrical appliances. the duties include installation, operation, adjustment, routine maintenance, inspection, test and repair of electrical equipment. em's also perform maintenance and repair of related electronic equipment. nuclear-trained ems perform duties in nuclear propulsion plants operating reactor control, propulsion and power generation systems.  electronics technicians (et)  ets are responsible for electronic equipment used to send and receive messages, computer information systems, long range radar, and calibration of test equipment. they maintain, repair, calibrate, tune, and adjust electronic equipment used for communications, detection and tracking, recognition and identification and navigation. nuclear-trained ets perform duties in nuclear propulsion plants operating reactor control, propulsion and power generation systems.  interested in submarine service? learn more about life on a sub.  work environment as an enlisted sailor working in nuclear operations, you’ll have the opportunity to work at sea or ashore. your assignment could also place you in an intense, fast-paced environment aboard a nuclear-powered submarine or aircraft carrier.  training & advancement navy nuclear field (nf) program upon completion of initial 7–9 week recruit training (known as boot camp), those pursuing a nuclear operations role report to “a” school for technical training based on their specific job rating, and then move on to acquire advanced nuclear training.  “a” school for mms – the three-month machinist’s mate (mm) course in charleston, s. c., provides a basic knowledge of technical mathematics and understanding of the theory and operation of a steam power plant. students learn to operate tools, test equipment and system components, read blueprints, practice rigging techniques, and perform maintenance procedures. from there, it’s on to nnps and nptu (see below).  “a” school for ems – the six-month electrician’s mate (em) course in charleston, s. c., provides a basic knowledge of technical mathematics and power distribution. students learn to solve basic equations using phasors, vector notations and basic trigonometry and analyze dc and ac circuits. they also learn how to operate electrical equipment using controllers, and how to properly test, maintain, troubleshoot, and repair electrical circuits, motors and other related electrical equipment. from there, it’s on to nnps and nptu (see description below).  “a” school for ets – the six-month electronics technician (et) course in charleston, s. c., provides a basic knowledge of technical mathematics and a good working knowledge of electricity and electronics, solid-state devices, digital logic and systems, microprocessors, and instrumentation and control circuits. students learn how to interpret schematic diagrams and use appropriate test equipment to isolate and correct faults in electronic systems. from there, it’s on to nnps and nptu (see description below).  naval nuclear power school (nnps) – upon completion of “a” school training, mms, ems and ets attend naval nuclear power school (nnps) in charleston, s. c. here they learn theory and practical application of nuclear physics and reactor engineering. the six-month course provides a comprehensive understanding of a pressurized-water naval nuclear power plant, including reactor core nuclear principles, heat transfer and fluid systems, plant chemistry and materials, mechanical and electrical systems, and radiological control.  nuclear power training unit (nptu) – following nnps, mms, ems and ets begin prototype training in their rating specialty at one of two nuclear power training units (nptus) – located in charleston, s. c., and ballston spa, n. y. this six-month course teaches the fundamentals of a naval nuclear power plant and the interrelationship of its mechanical, electrical, and reactor subsystems. students develop oral communications skills, obtain an understanding of nuclear radiation, and gain knowledge of the safe operation of a complex naval nuclear power plant.  for all nuclear power trained ratings, promotion opportunities are regularly available but competitive and based on performance. it’s also important to note that specialized training received and work experience gained in the course of service can lead to valuable credentialing and occupational opportunities in related fields.  education opportunities beyond offering access to professional credentials and certifications, navy technical and operational training in the field of nuclear operations can translate to up to 77 credit hours toward a bachelor’s or associate degree through the american council on education. you may also continue your education through opportunities like the following:  navy college program and tuition assistance post-9/11 gi bill  qualifications & requirements a high-school diploma or equivalent is required to become an enlisted sailor in the nuclear operations field in the navy. those seeking one of these positions must be us citizens with successful completion of one year of algebra, and who can meet eligibility requirements for a security clearance.  general qualifications may vary depending upon whether you’re currently serving, whether you’ve served before or whether you’ve never served before.

technology / low-voltage designer - engineer turpin & rattan engineering san diego, ca  team member will work closely with designers, engineers and clients. work with lead designer on technology portion of projects to remain responsive, exceed client expectation, meet multi-disciplinary objectives, and adhere to project budget and schedule requirements. assist lead designer to define project scope, coordinate on project proposals, prepare designs for technology / low-voltage systems, and provide support during project construction administration phase. field work will be expected and require interaction with client personnel. a large portion of projects occur at educational facilities; candidates with similar experience preferred  minimum requirements:  3-4 years of experience with design of building technology systems project management experience with project deliverables, effective team communication, and demonstrated client satisfaction experience with autocad and revit bim software strong desire to work with team members and maintain client relationships demonstrated previous success with project design from inception to completion  preferred:  knowledge of bicsi registered communications distribution designer (rcdd) standards experience with educational facilities participate in efforts to sustain an innovative and forward thinking work environment  what turpin & rattan engineering, inc. offers:  competitive wages and a generous benefits package support for a balance between professional and personal life a open office environment that encourages interaction and innovation recognized as one of the top firms in our industry for providing a desirable work environment for employees. to apply for an open position, please email your resume with the position title in the subject line to engineer@treisd. com

sr. mechanical design engineer (vacuum platform/source design) kla-tencor milpitas, ca 95035  job opening id: 123293 milpitas, ca, united states full-time regular company overview calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. at kla, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.  who are we? we research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. we enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. we create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. we're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. the future is calling. will you answer? group/division the rapid division is the world leading provider of reticle inspection solutions for the semiconductor industry. the company provides inspection solutions to both the mask shops and the semiconductor fabs to ensure that lithography yields are consistently high thus enabling cost-effective manufacturing. responsibilities design of precision components, modules and subsystems, focused in mechanical design, to support the design of the next generation reticle inspection tools. responsible for the complete design process, including: driving requirements specification feasibility studies cost and scheduling conceptual and detailed design, detailed drawings, using 3d solid modeling (proe/creo) conducting various analysis, such as fluid, thermal, vibrational, and fea modeling understanding of geometric tolerancing (gd&t) detailed tolerance stack-up analysis hold design reviews throughout design process procurement of prototype parts prototype assembly and testing system integration and testing create assembly and test procedures documentation release and handoff to manufacturing. these tasks will require working with other engineering groups such as optics engineers, systems engineers and manufacturing + service engineers to ensure flawless integration and test at the subsystem and system level. work closely with and manage suppliers to ensure all design requirements are specified and achieved. address and resolve product issues thru the product phases. design challenges may include: precision design with large tolerance stack-ups ultra-high vacuum design abilities & experience strong leadership, communication and problem solving skills. minimum 4 years work experience in 3d solid modeling background in the design of mechanisms. basic understanding of optical subsystems. familiar with manufacturing processes including machining, sheet metal fabrication, welding fabrication and castings. participate in and lead design reviews to obtain a peer-oriented design assessment. contribute to team effort to accomplish overall objectives as needed. demonstrate perseverance and a drive to be better. qualifications strong mechanical engineering fundamentals, including design principles, machine elements, materials, fabrication methods. must be proficient with solid cad (proengineer/creo skill strongly preferred). experience in several of these areas is desirable: opto-mechanical systems, ultra-high vacuum systems, design of inspection equipment or similar instruments, motion controls, electronics, data acquisition systems such as labview, measurement instrumentation, tooling & test fixture design, supplier management, new product introduction, manufacturing support should have experience in thermal, structural analysis and fluid flow modeling (pro/mechanica, ansys, cf design skill strongly preferred). minimum qualifications bs degree plus 8 years, or master's degree plus 6 years, or ph. d. degree plus 3 years of relevant experience and accomplishments. equal employment opportunity kla is an equal opportunity employer. applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

java, full-stack engineer assistments chicago, il $90,000 - $120,000 a year job descriptionassistments, an online teaching and learning tool, has been in use by teachers for many years, but very recently, we’ve skyrocketed our efforts to enhance the product and expand our users while also improving their experience. we seek a junior to mid-level software engineer to join our highly capable engineering team, whose current focus is on developing the future architecture of assistments. in this role you will support the next phase of development of our web-based educational technology application intended to be used by millions of students and teachers, improving the future of teaching and learning. reporting to the vp of product and engineering, the role requires deep collaboration with the rest of the engineering and design teams as well as various departments across the organization. we seek candidates who thrive in a nimble, start-up environment and are comfortable stepping into a variety of existing initiatives while also enjoying innovation and harnessing new ideas. the assistments foundation is currently a small and nimble staff of 6 and we share priorities and collaborate with the assistments project at worcester polytechnic institute, where there are approximately 10 staff members and a dozen graduate students who work solely on the assistments project. main responsibilitiesdesign and development work for new functionality and services in all layers of the assistments platformanalysis and debugging of existing code in response to both customer and internally-identified issuescommunication and collaboration with designers, engineers, educational researchers, user experience experts to understand and execute on both customer-facing and technical requirements. desired qualificationsdegree in engineering and/or computer science highly desirable.2+ years experience with java web-based application and software designexperience with the following frameworks/platforms strongly preferred: spring, vue, gwt, html5, css, javascript, bootstrap, postgresql, maven, tomcat, nginx, redis, python. experience with aws preferred. strong collaboration and communication skills essential. passion for creating excellent products. examples of working code that you have produced for at least one other project and the ability to explain what you’ve built and how it achieved the requirements or solved the problem you were presented with. this is a full time position and at present, we are fully remote and we are flexible with local and/or remote applicants. prior to covid, our offices were based in worcester, massachusetts (near the wpi campus). take some time to learn more about assistments and then apply. incomplete applications will not be accepted. as an equal opportunity employer, the assistments foundation seeks not just to accept difference - but to celebrate, support and thrive on it for the benefit of our staff, our product and our community. employment is based solely on someone’s merit and qualifications directly related to their professional competence. we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. the law aside, we also do this because we believe it’s the right way to treat people. job type: full-timepay: $90,000.00 - $120,000.00 per yearexperience:relevant: 2 years (preferred)work location:fully remotethis job is:a good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or morecompany's website:www. assistments. orgcompany's facebook page:https://www. facebook. com/assistments/benefit conditions:only full-time employees eligiblework remotely:yes
